title: Matchsafe, "Hunting Scene with Female Equestrian", ca. 1900
markings: STERLING, 975 (poor impression), and another illegible mark, all stamped on bezel.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular, with curves and counter-curves along ornate perimeter, featuring raised decoration of female equestrian on horse, jumping over wooden fence, tree and grass in foreground and background, scene is framed by elaborate scroll work, lid features fox head with scroll work surround; reverse features variation on decorative scroll work frame, scroll work on lid as well, reserve empty except for incised initials "J.C.L." Lid hinged on side. Striker on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Hunting Scene with Female Equestrian", ca. 1900.
ca. 1900. Silver. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-1328.
